p.s: The Sonnet 65 by William Shakespeare is a typical English sonnet where 14 verses are giving.
They are divided into three quatrains.
They are telling a story and informing us about Shakespear'sShakespeare's topic.
The last two lines are summing everything up and giving us his final awnseranswer how his topic is solved.
The last two rhymes are called the final couplet.
The first three quatrains are crossrhymed and the couplet is a pairrhymepair rhyme.
This leads to the fact, that the rhyme scheme is ABABCDCDEFEFGG.
Taking a look on each verse, Shakespeare is using ten iambics.
There are divided into five unstressed iambic.
The sonnet talks about that beauty and love can notcannot teast for everforever because human feelings are hold on to a specific livetimelifetime.
The time goes on and nobody can stop it.
It is ana forever going process and not even strong parts of the nature are able to survive.
That is the reason why beauty can notcannot leastlast forever, because people are altering.
But when love and beauty are supostedsupposed to stay forever, that means the only way to safesave it is to write it down on paper, that the words can leastlast theirthere forever.
